description.narrative: (1) Rural growth and employment: The Project supports the expansion of a successful pulp and paper company in the frontier regions of China. The Company procures bamboo from around 6,000 rural households in frontier Guangxi and Jiangxi regions. As a result of its expansion, the Company will have a significant impact and extensive rural reach by procuring from additional 6,000 rural households, and creating business opportunities for MSMEs, such as traders of bamboo, truck owners, distributors, etc. (2) Sustainability: Pulp and paper sector is reported to account for a significant portion of water pollution in China and the sector places a huge demand for global wood resources. IFC will be supporting a Company with a keen desire to contribute to sustainable development by: (a) contributing to proper management of forest (bamboo) resources; (b) efficient manufacturing, and (c) adopting and ensuring workplace safety and pollution control.

Guangxi Hwagain Group Co., Ltd (Hwagain or the Company) plans to expand its tissue production capacity in Jiangxi Province (the Project). The proposed Project consists of a new pulp mill and two tissue paper production lines. Ultimately, the Company aims to become a regional tissue paper leader in China.
